doc.field: New York University Archives Collection of University-Related Materials
New York University Archives Collection of University-Related Materials

New York Universiy Archives serves as the final repository for the historical records of NYU. This collection consists of correspondence and ephemera collected by the New York University Archives. The collection contains an 1838 letter relating to financing for the construction of New York University's University Building, and the efforts of then-Attorney General Benjamin Franklin Butler to secure debt relief for the University in that matter. The collection also includes a framed promotional card for NYU Athletics (specifically, track and field) alongside an associated tobacco leather from Harvard, as well as a certificate issued by the New York Fire Department documenting their inspection of the University Heights' Sanitary Engineering Research Lab.

The collection contains an 1838 letter relating to financing for the construction of New York University's University Building, and the efforts of then-Attorney General Benjamin Franklin Butler to secure debt relief for the University in that matter. The collection also includes a framed promotional card for NYU Athletics (specifically, track and field) alongside an associated tobacco leather from Harvard, as well as a certificate issued by the New York Fire Department documenting their inspection of the University Heights' Sanitary Engineering Research Lab.

This collection consists of correspondence and ephemera collected by the New York University Archives. The collection contains an 1838 letter relating to financing for the construction of New York University's University Building, and the efforts of then-Attorney General Benjamin Franklin Butler to secure debt relief for the University in that matter. The collection also includes a framed promotional card for NYU Athletics (specifically, track and field) alongside an associated tobacco leather from Harvard, as well as a certificate issued by the New York Fire Department documenting their inspection of the University Heights' Sanitary Engineering Research Lab.

New York Universiy Archives serves as the final repository for the historical records of NYU. Its primary purpose is to document the history of the University and to provide source material for administrators, faculty, students, alumni, and other members of the University community, as well as scholars, authors, and other interested persons who seek to evaluate the impact of the University's activities on the history of American social, cultural, and intellectual development.

Donated by Robert and Nevine Melikian, August 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.074. In September 2022 by Dee Cardenas, daughter of Raul Cardenas, a graduate and former faculty member of the School of Engineering, donated a certificate documenting an inspection on the Heights campus by the New York Fire Department; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.075. In September 2022 Amelia Byrnes, Executive Assistant, Office of the Dean, College of Arts and Science transferred a promotional athletic card; the accession number for this transfer is 2022.076.
Benjamin Franklin Butler letter purchased at auction and donated through the NYU Office of Planned Giving, then transferred to the University Archives.

In ink on the back of the framed athletic card is the name Irving H. Jurow; it is possible these materials were gifted to the Dean by Jurow. Jurow was a graduate of the University. An endowed lecture series at the College is named for Jurow (as is a scholarship fund, an academic award at the School of Law, and a lecture hall within the Silver Center).
